hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A modern brand under the Hyatt group. Love the vibe of the Hyatt Centric Times Square NY. Staff were friendly and attentive without being too uptight like some of the 5-star hotels. Room was clean and spacious. Definitely coming back when we are able to travel again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed in the Hyatt Centric Times Square for four nights and were very, very pleased. I requested early check-in, since we were arriving about 5 hours before the 4 p.m. check-in. They held our luggage so we could go out and grab lunch and they texted me when our room was ready (2-3 hours early). The room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The beds were super-comfortable, which is a big deal to me - I often have a hard time sleeping, so supportive pillows and soft linens are really important. Towels and toiletries were replenished every day; we never had to ask for anything.The location on 45th Street is steps away from Times Square and most of the theaters; across the street from a Starbucks; and just a couple blocks away (in various directions) to Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, and the train stations around 42nd Street. It was a roughly 20-minute walk from the hotel to the Intrepid Air, Sea and Space Museum. This hotel was an excellent home base for us; no matter where we were in the morning or early afternoon, we'd come back to rest for a bit before our evening plans.Years ago we had a terrible experience at a "proper" Hyatt in Florida and I wasn't sure I'd ever go to a high-end Hyatt property again. We've stayed in a Hyatt Place and liked it, but it took us six or seven years to be willing to try a property like this one. And they made it so wonderful. If you're looking for a comfortable hotel to be your home base in Times Square/Midtown, give Hyatt Centric Times Square a try.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A great hotel, just off Times Square. Great view from our floor to ceiling windows. Very modern, and great size rooms, especially for New York. Only downside was that the children were not permitted in the bar area. The view from the bar is fantasticwitj a clear view to the Chrysler building. You can also see the hotel quite clearly from the Top of The Rock!The housekeeping staff were great too.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stay at a lot of Hyatts (Im a globalist) and I think the Hyatt Place on 39/9 is idea. It is close to everything a tourist likes but is a few blocks away from the craziness of Times Square, giving you lots of dining options in Hell's Kitchen. The staff is so attentive and wonderful. I had a few requests while there and they attended to each of them. Its a brand new property so the rooms and clean and fresh. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was our first time at a Hyatt Centric brand hotel and our expectations were certainly surpassed. Excellent front-desk staff (points for keeping the lobby dry on rainy days). Rooms are above average in size for the area and clean with modern features. Bonus points for the rooftop bar. Could use some additional snack options though there is a Starbucks right across the street and, of course, plenty just around the corner in Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great reception when we arrived. Not only friendly and courteous but our room was upgraded at no extra charge. On the 39th floor we had an excellent view of NYC. The bathroom floor was heated, a welcomed surprise during the colder months. The Rooftop Bar on the 54th floor was a great space to relax and again have great views of the city. We will use this hotel again. We travel at least once a year to the city.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at the Hyatt Centric for 7 nights and the it met every one of our needs as a couple exploring the city, for a very reasonable price!! The location was great, with Times Square just a stone's throw away and plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. We had a king size room on the 19th floor, which was very spacious, lovely bathroom and shower. The staff were very accommodating, with our room being made every day, fresh towels, and coffee and water bottles being topped up daily. The roof top bar had amazing views, but rather expensive... Would definitely recommend!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our visit to NYC was lovely. The Hyatt Centric Times Square was fabulous! The shower was AMAZING. The location was perfect. The staff was very attentive to all needs/requests. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here for four nights. Due to the pandemic NYC was very quiet so we were offered the chance to upgrade the room for $25 per night, we declined this as didn’t intend on being in the room that much. The room we had, on 20th floor, was really nice. Could see some of time square lights, plenty of room (By NYC standards) and a big bathroom. The hotel is yards from time square, an ideal location if you are a first timer to New York. I felt the pricing was a little inconsistent, when we asked before we arrived about cars to and from the airport we were quoted $120 (ish) each way, however, when we asked at the hotel it was $75 set fee. We opted for this as it was only $5 more than the total price of a set fee yellow cab. When we asked to keep the room on it was $50 per hour, which seemed excessive considering NYC was in an emergency situation and travel was prohibited from a lot of countries so rooms were available and an upgrade was only $25.Staff were helpful when needed. It’s clean and tidy but for some reason we both got electric shocks off of everything we touched. We ended up touching everything through clothes, which I suppose wasn’t bad thing considering the circumstances. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My grandaughter left her Apple Air Pods. They secured them for us. We had to leave unexpectedly and they were extremely understanding. The roof top bar is outstanding but not pretentious. The ground floor level bar/restaurant was very nice as well. Everyone was helpful and courteous .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: the hyatt centric and lotis soriano went above and beyond to make my daugher's birthday memorable . they had the room decorated with balloons, birthday banner and a birthday gift when we arrived. my daughter was so surprised when we walked into our room. thanks again !!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric came as a huge surprise. This was my first experience at a Hyatt property in the US and my only previous frames of reference in terms of US hotels were Marriott and Hilton properties. This was a long 16-day trip and I was more than a little concerned about being comfortable. I was so cautious that I had my office split the booking so that I could check out if I was not happy. This hotel blew me away. The room and bathroom were great and everything worked the way it should. The decor and color schemes made everything seem airy and light. But the X Factor was the service. I have never experienced this level of warmth and friendliness outside of Taj, ITC and Shangri La properties in Asia. The staff were efficient, proactive, warm and friendly and they anticipated my needs. The GM of this hotel deserves to be commended for putting together and leading such a great crew. From Dyana and Michael at the reception; to Mickey at the bar; to Veronica in housekeeping to Jason, Walter and Luis, the doormen...HUGE shout out! What else can I say except that I will be back.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Located near Times Square and walking distance to almost everything!Certainly well priced in comparison to other hotels. May be more modern but meets all and any needs.Very clean rooms, great service, friendly staff. Enjoy the bar area.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Well situated, clean, small and comfortable, very easy going hotel, good service, personal very much willing to help in any kind of situations...makes your stay easy and cool.All the best shows around the corner. All you wish for a nice stay!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for 10 nights in a delux--2 room suite. Floor 43. Fantastic view and GREAT staff in all areas of this hotel, My previous favorite hotel in NYC was Double Tree Suites Time Square which is now only history as it was completely torn down in 2019. The site will be a CTX luxury hotel, which is being built now to open in 2022. This Hyatt is better located than the Doubletree was as it is a half block down 45th st. from Broadway (heart of times square) AWAY from the constent crowds. The Doubletrees front door opened on to Broadway and was alwaus a mess. You pay for a better view if you reserve a room above floor 40. DO IT as you will be happy you did. Also, buy the breakfast package with the rooom. You eat in the very nice hotel restaurant NOT a buffet and order off the menu , the same meniu walk-ins order from. Average daily breakfast check for 2 was $50-$75 a day, and GOOD food. I will stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: New York are clearly getting in on the Vegas scam of charging resort fees locally on top of prebooked room rates. Resort Fees here are $30 per room per night. They are not optional and must be paid. If they can't afford to run the hotel based on their advertised room rates then they should increase their rates, not draw people in with artificially low rates topped up with "Resort Fees". Apparently its for Wi-Fi, water in room and I think that's it.A deposit of $100 is required and check in is not possible without it. It must be on a hold on a card or if you want to leave a cash deposit its $350.00. Great location if you want to be right on top of Times Square, it is literally out the door turn right and a few steps you're there!The hotel public areas around the reception are fairly small with only one small seating area and a bar where breakfast is served.The rooms are fairly standard, good quality rooms you would expect from a Hyatt. Modern with a single seat and table. Our room had a great view as you could see down to Times Square.It was a good stay and the staff we encountered were all pleasant.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I booked a king room on a lower floor for a conference I was attending. The room was clean and in good order. My favorite thing about the room, however, is the bathroom. I always get chilly when I sleep and the heated floor makes for a welcome comfort during the cooler months. The lighting is good as well and consists of options for your needs, such as a dimmed night light. The shower is spacious and has a choice of either an overhead rainfall shower or a handheld shower head.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel in the most perfect location. It's just off Times Square so in the best position to see all the sites. The hop on hop off buses were just a short walk away.There were so many places to eat with a small coffee shop attached to the side of the hotel.Everyone in the hotel was pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Had a fabulous time, third visit to this hotel. location excellent for Times Square, subway and Rockefeller centre. Treated myself to an upgrade this time ! Would recommend ! Staff as always very friendly and helpful

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Hyatt Centric Times Square New York is in a great location in Times Square. We were located on the 36th floor and had great views of the city. The hotel is located in walking distance of numerous subways so easy to visit other neighbourhoods in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location was excellent in the middle of everything, excellent views from our room, very nice bathroom, comfortable bed. Everyone was professional and friendly. Would have no issues staying here again. Would have been nice to have more dresser drawer space. This was limited.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel room view was excellent. Deluxe King with City View. 44th floor. Room has floor to ceiling Windows overlooking the city. Could see the Paramount building perfectly and Freedom Tower (from a distance). Worth the extra $$ for the room. I would def stay here again, but be aware the bar on the 54th floor is very expensive! But in a way you are paying for the view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Can not be closer to Times Square than this hotel. Much better condition and larger room than Marriott, Renaissance or W hotels nearby. Got upgrade to a suite due to my elite status. Perfect for a small group business meeting. There was only one bar/restaurant though for good breakfast but simple lunch. Was able to walk to the Penn Station in 14 minutes for a train to EWR airport. Will definitely stay here next time.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Lovely Hotel, very clean with quality bed and fixtures.We was on the 44th floor overlooking Times Square, well recommended :)Although drinks and food are very expensive in the Hotel there are plenty of places local and a lot cheaper

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Destination fee has no real benefits except force guests to spend more. Good service but no value for the price compared to similar NYC properties. Will choose another hotel next time. Average experience Overpriced food and beverageWill not return

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed here with my 2 daughter age 15 and 23, we couldn’t fault it. The room was spacious, comfy beds and great bathroom facilities. A great central location we walked everywhere. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would have given an excellent score had the restaurant not let it down. I contacted the hotel prior to arrival to see if they do anything special for birthdays, as our trip was for my husband’s birthday, a lovely lady named Lotis gave me a list of options available and I must say she went above & beyond in her customer service to make his birthday extra special, even giving us $75 credit to spend in the hotel. We used the credit towards his birthday meal at T45 which we regretted as most of our food was returned uneaten, the starters weren’t great, my husband’s steak was medium not medium rare and my son’s burger was raw! The staff were disinterested, no apology & no contact from the F&B team after I emailed my complaint, would not recommend the restaurant as the food was overpriced & underwhelming! However, our hotel room (on 51st floor) was clean & spacious with good sized bathroom, it’s a shame the Hyatt don’t have family rooms with one queen & two single beds instead of two queens like most european hotels as 2 siblings sharing a bed can cause arguments. The hotel is in a great location, although you do pay $40 a night resort fee for the privilege which wasn’t mentioned when we checked in, we only knew through reading trip advisor, and we were not given any discounts etc. or told what the fee was for. There is a Starbucks over the road for your morning coffee. Walter, the doorman, is very helpful & friendly and organised our ride back to the airport, which was much more comfortable than the yellow cab we arrived on. Thanks again to Lotis & Walter I hope Hyatt give recognition to their staff that go the extra mile.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Next time I will stay at the local neighborhood alternatives where this mandatory $30 daily destination fee can be redeemed for anything including wine or cocktails The $10 a day towards food is not acceptable Beware when choosing this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Vedy modern, clean hotel, with good service, comfortable rooms and an amazing roof top bar. It's a shame it's so expensive. There's a comfortable restaurant by the rather small lobby where you can have breakfast and other meals. Unfortunately the breakfast servicw was very slow, although the food (when it finally came) was good.

Chris G
Province of Girona, Spain

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff at this property is AMAZING, from check in all the way until I departed the entire staff made sure that my stay was great. Your front desk staff, especially Diane are the best I have interacted with in years and I applaud you guys for making sure that everyone was trained to provide the best customer service possible and to follow through on everything! I was pleasantly surprised and shocked by the awesomeness of the entire staff.... far better and superior customer service then your sister up there on 57th! (PHNYC)The room was spotless, the Heat & AC worked well, the water pressure and temp were spot on.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A few steps from Times Square. Very comfortable beds and pillows. Efficient heating/air conditioning. Helpful staff. The rooftop bar is lovely and intimate; the views are amazing! Prices were high in the bar but the experience was worth it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location for getting around (close to Times Square, subway and trains). Rooms clean and staff friendly. Overall an average hotel experience in terms of quality. Quite expensive especially food and drink and don't forget a daily city charge + tax will be added to your final bill, something like $30 per day

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: It's been years since I've experienced such costumer-centered hospitality at a large hotel. The staff was absolutely terrific. They knew my name and room number each time that I approached the desk without ever checking their records. They were friendly and very willing to help in any way that myself (and my guests- we occupied 4 total rooms) needed. Personable hospitality in the midst of Times Square- win win!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean, comfortable room with floor to ceiling windows overlooking Times Square! Staff was courteous and helpful especially Grace from security. I am very claustrophobic, and she gladly rode the elevator with me to the rooftop bar and returned later to make sure I got back down. So glad I made it up there ... my Ryan Goslings craft cocktail was excellent and the spectacular views made it worth the price!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My daughter and I had a wonderful vacation in NYC. The hotel was clean, in a great location, had helpful staff, good room service, a nice rooftop, and was affordable. We will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed here only one night but enjoyed our stay. Our room was large as well as the bathroom. Floor to ceiling windows with a beautiful view. The bar on the 54th floor was spectacular, the view was great and the drinks and service was super. I will return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent. For those of you that think there is no wardrobe space after watching quite a few YouTube Videos, there is. It just looks like an adjoining door and the handle is a little stiff to pull.When we got there my wife read somewhere that the room is cleaned every three days, this wasn’t the case, it was cleaned every day with new towels, linen and water.Not sure if this was because we left a two to three dollar tip for them every time, but was well worth it.Because we were in Times Square I was also told we would hear loads of traffic noise from the room, we didn’t and we were on the 12th floor.The only downside was our view from the window wasn’t really that great, we could see the side of the Barclays building and another building under construction but no noise and that was the main thing.Most places in Times square are so busy and hard to just find a seat and have a coffee, however the Starbucks that is opposite to this hotel always had seats available. Nice to go there to clear your head if you need space from how busy 20 seconds around the corner is.By the way we knew we would have to pay tax on the room as you do for all hotels in New York. I believe sometimes this may be part of your package and it maybe worth asking the question before you book They put a hold on your Card when you arrive the same amount as what the room costs, so take this into consideration if you have assigned an amount of money you will spend in New York because a large amount will be taken as soon as you arrive to cover any charges on the room. To be fair you will get this back but minus the tax which in our case was $172 for five nights. We have only come back and not received it yet but I am sure we will.So if you have loaded up a pre paid card as we did try to add extra onto it because you won’t be spending this in New York and will be coming back with you, which is always nice to come back to.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Ended up on the 51st floor of this gem of a hotel. Fantastic - but bright - views of lower Manhattan.The room was comfortable. The service was great. The hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. The subway isn't right outside of the hotel but it's not too far. Overall, very pleasant.However, the biggest surprise was the bar on the 54th floor. Spectacular views with an outdoor deck!I'd be happy to stay here again. Everything in midtown is within walking distance and downtown is a 20 minute subway ride. A wonderful find.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Disappointed by how basic the hotel was.Reasons being:1. Other than soap, shower gel and shampoo, there were no other bathroom essentials provided. Everything had to be requested which I found odd and inconvenient, especially for a Hyatt property.2. The pillows in the room were much too soft for me. I requested a firm pillow (which any decent hotel I've been to has - some hotels have a range of pillows including memory foam) but I was informed the hotel did not have any firm pillows - I thought that was odd.3. Hotels in NYC which are charging a resort / destination fee need to be highlighted, it's essentially a scam. Just because some other hotels do it and because it's detailed on the Hyatt website does NOT make it ok. This Hyatt cannot justify the $35 ($40.16 with tax) fee per night (!) with the very poor 'benefits' provided. More guests need to challenge the fee, otherwise more and more hotels will continue to add it to the headline rate.4. I was surprised at the lack of communal space - the lobby is tiny and there's nowhere to sit and relax other than the bar.As for location, if you want to be near Time Square then the location can't be beaten, but if you've been to NYC more than once then you may appreciate being away from the hustle and bustle.In terms of value for money, I booked my room at a promotional price so I thought the value for money was acceptable, but seeing how much the rooms are normally I would say this hotel is NOT good value for money as I would expect more luxury for the price.Overall this isn't a bad hotel, just not the luxury what you might expect from a Hyatt property.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: LOVED everything about this place. The queen deluxe room was over the top amazing. Huge room with huge bathroom. Loved the birthday surprise in our room. Loved the down comforters, very warm. Easy to adjust lighting and room temperatures. Floor to Ceiling window with gorgeous view. Awesome waterfall shower. Two things I didn't like was the down pillows- a little too soft for my liking and the elevator to go down (I was on the 53rd floor) took a while. I would 100% be coming back to the Hyatt next time and requesting the same room. This was a fabulous place!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a lovely room with a spectacular view on the 33rd floor. The room was large with ample storage space. The room attendant kept the room very clean and always replenished the toiletries we used.The bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed some of the best sleep we have had in New York.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is a nice property. We were pleased with the room and its location, as it is a short walk to everything. I drove in to take advantage of the valet parking.What's the not so good? To start, destination fees. This was a 40 dollar per night surprise add on that was not mentioned when I booked or upon check in.Next issue: valet parking. They charge at least 30 dollars more than nearby garages in the area, but I get that it will cost more.The problem is they double parked my car in the middle of 45th street instead of at the curb. Valet should be convenient and safe. I didn't think this to be either especially from a value perspective. So just ok is all I can say for this place.
user_name:
RODNEY L
New Brunswick, New Jersey

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Booked for 4 nights. Arrived a day late due to a fight being cancelled. So we only stayed 3 nights. The hotel was very understanding about this and very helpful. Checked in absolutely fine, no wait what so ever. Lovely room. 2 queen beds. Room cleaned every day to a high standard. Now here comes the killer. Went to check out and reading previous reviews I was aware of this ‘destination fee’. Honestly it’s a bloody ripoff. The things that are included are just stupid to charge for. $35 a night per room the charge. Now a previous said above, we missed one night due to our flight being cancelled. They still charged us this stupid fee. So we payed an extra $35 for not even being in the room and getting these ‘privileges’ (term used very loosely!’ I argued this with they guy at reception only to be told a load of crap. I’d love to come back and stay at the hotel if they get rid of this destination fee. You’ll kill the hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The night before I checked in I was told by a representative that I could check in between 12 and 1. I arrived a little after 1 and was told my room wouldn't be ready til 4. There are no benefits to bring a Hyatt member. No discounts, fees waived, or extras.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Clean, large rooms. Very friendly team.Central location, but high up enough room to be very quiet. Enjoyed the restaurant-very friendly servers/bar staff.Only annoyance was the "destination fee" that came as a surprise.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, central to everything and within walking distance to Central Park and Chelsea if you can brave the cold NY winter. The room was very comfortable and clean. The staff friendly and attentive. L54 has the most amazing rooftop bar with views over the city! No noise whatsoever from Times Square although you are only a 100 metres away. Loved it and would certainly stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed here a number of times on business and would recommend it as a good place to base yourself on a visit to NYC. Beside Times Square and Broadway shows and walking distance to a lot of amenities and shopping. Rooms are pleasant and well appointed with a modern feel. Good showers. Tea and coffee in room and a fridge (empty). Roof top bar.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfect spot, great staff. Would highly recommend to anyone going to New York and hoping to see all hot spots in a short-ish time period! Walking distance to most places and near a subway station if needing to travel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I’ll preface this by saying the location is awesome and the room was spacious and clean. I stayed in the Suite facing Times Square. The room was big enough for our family of 4 and the bathroom was the best part. Heated floors and room enough for all of us to be walking in the bathroom at the same time. Now besides that. My vacation started off stressful. I was never made aware before getting to the hotel that I would be charged all of my vacation plus $100 deposit per night. A “hold” was placed on my card that I was not going to use to pay for the hotel but had no alternative at the time was blocked for almost $2000. What I was gonna use for my vacation. When I’m questioning why I have to essentially pay before I even get in my room. The response is “this is how it always is” with an attitude. I’ve been to many hotels and many higher end hotels and none of them do this. They take a deposit and your card on file but no one blocks the entire stay plus a deposit for the duration of your stay + 5 days that it takes for the hold to drop. When I mention that this have never been done before in other hotels I’ve stayed at the response from the team member is “I’ve stayed at other hotels too” again with his attitude. I honestly don’t need that attitude. I’m on vacation and I’m already stressing and I don’t see how him staying at other hotels has anything to do in this situation. Off to a horrible start I didn’t even want to deal with the front desk anymore. The housekeeping staff however was wonderful and attentive. Always would say good morning and even hoped to see us again soon. Our second interaction with the front desk same person went even worse. My brother got to the hotel with his suitcase in the middle of the night as he had to take a red eye. I understand they ask to make sure he’s staying there. That’s fine no problem. But when he says he is they give him a card and say it’s $40/daily charge for the hotel. That didn’t make sense because we already had booked 4 people and been charged for the daily hotel fee for 4 people. When my mom went to ask about it to make sure it was already included and not additional. Just needed some clarification the team member again with an attitude called my brother liar saying no one had said it was $40 when it was written on his key card envelope they gave him. My mom said I’m not saying you did I’m asking for clarification and he just seemed like he didn’t want to deal with anything. We just left and avoided them the rest of the time. After that they didn’t seem approachable and didn’t feel like I could ask them questions about the city. In all honesty I personally won’t be staying again. Initial interaction and welcome is what makes or breaks it for me. I do recommend the room though. But that’s all I recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was in a great location and nice overall. Our check in process was quick, easy and informative. The WiFi was excellent. Our only issue was that the bathroom door did not lock and one of the sliding doors to the bedroom did not work properly. We only spent one night there as it was just a layover to catch a flight the next morning.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location, nice room, gorgeous view! Good service! What else do you need for your vacation in New York?Good drink? There it’s! But it’s pricey. You’ll forget about price of drinks, when you see the view.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I always stay at this hotel when coming in for a show or business. Rooms are clean and staff friendly. I like the rooftop bar but drinks and a simple glass of wine is $$$. That is my only negative. Parking is across the street if you drive!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed this hotel before cruise and enjoyed very much. The location is convenient to the subway station, walking to theaters and Times Square is easy.The breakfast at the hotel restaurant is pretty good too.We did not spend much time at the roof top bar, but it was amazing view. Must visit at least once!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I arrived around 11 am and was pleasantly suprised that I could have early check in!I had to complete work in my room Thurs-Fri and had disappointing experience with the front desk. On Thursday, I left the hotel around 12.30 and asked front desk to arrange housekeeping by 3 pm as I would be returning to my room, the man at helpdesk just said they'd put a notice up on the board to get it done, but the team is busy. Luckily when I returned the room had been cleaned. On Friday, again I asked front desk to arrange housekeeping at lunch (prior I had put up the "do not disturb") notice, the lady at front desk just said that as long as the notice was down, it would be done. I returned after lunch and housekeeping hadn't arrived, not until 4.30pm did I get a knock, I asked them to come back at 5pm.. I left and returned around 6.30 and only then was the housekeeping in my room, which is quite disappointing. I also asked front desk if I could get a later check out, after about 5 mins of clicking on the computer, she told me I could check out at noon. I'm pretty sure one hour extension is quite standard practise, if she was going to offer me til 3pm I'd understand wasting 5 minutes of my time! So I'm not sure the purpose of acting like that. My check out lady was nice though, so not all your front desk staff have bad attitude. The room was of a good size for NY expectation and bathroom clean, with basic amenities only. No bathrobe or toothbrush etc.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My sisters and I traveled with our adult daughters to NYC and could not have been happier with our stay at Hyatt Centric Times Square. The location is perfect, the staff is amazing and the hotel is just the right size and provides all the right amenities.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The staff at this hotel go way out of their way to make you feel welcome! The rooms are wonderful, the restaurant has delicious food, and the location is perfect! If you're visiting Midtown Manhattan, you must try this hotel!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hyatt Centric in Times Square.Hotel is in a great location, decent enough size room, loved the bathroom, fab shower.Disappointed in the paper cups for coffee/tea in room..for the price we paid I would have expected proper cups and normal milk, who wants creamer in tea?Rooftop bar does give great views but the cost of the drinks is quite ridiculous, $60 for two cocktails? We only stayed for one at that price.Picked up a couple of cans of Diet Pepsi from the restaurant on the ground floor $7 per can? A right rip off.Despite my husband messaging the hotel prior to our stay to inform them I would be celebrating my birthday during our visit, no little treats or upgrade was forthcoming, in fact they didn’t even bother replying..The biggest rip off for me though is the ridiculous Destination Fee which added almost $200 to our bill and gave us absolutely nothing in return. I understand it’s just a way for these big chains to avoid paying tax, but come on, just add it to the room cost at the point of booking and pay your taxes..it’s not like you don’t make enormous profits...you can afford it...stop ripping people off with these charges I mean as if anyone wants 10% of some naff health drink etc..pathetic...Would we book again? Possibly but would make sure we didn’t spend anything at the hotel during our stay next time to make up for that destination charge.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Just spent 5 nights at the Hyatt Centric last week. This was our 4th stay here. I meet my best friend every January for a week of theatre, exploration and decompression after the holidays. After a 10 hour journey, we were greeted at the front desk by Steven who was so kind and gracious and provided the perfect welcome. During our stay we encountered a problem with one of our bathroom lights and Lotis was extemely communicative and kind. Sean, the front desk manager was very helpful with suggestions and ideas on how to fill spare between shows. Walter, Louis and Ed outside are always so friendly and quick to offer tips and suggestions. The room was big, clean and in great shape. I try to stay at Hyatts when I travel, but when I go to NYC there is no doubt that I am a Hyatt Centric loyalist. The people, service and attention to detail is unsurpassed. See you all next year!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Destination fees were not disclosed until I received my bill... I thought that was totally unprofessional and I feel as though you aRE TAKING ADVANTAGE OF YOUR CUSTOMERS unless you let us know about these fees up front.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Once again the Hyatt chain provided a first rate, friendly welcoming service, could not fault anything. The staff were accompanying with their support and the T45 bar was brilliant, vibrant and the views were immense.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This was the nicest hotel I've stayed in, in NYC. The room was very spacious and was efficient at blocking out external noise. The bed was more comfortable than my bed at home and everything was very clean. I look forward to going here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Location was perfect for my business meeting at Marriott Marquis. The in-house restaurant and bar were a perfect place for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Staff was friendly and the hotel was clean and comfortable. I especially appreciated the flat pillows.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Close to time square rooms are clean also the bathroom staff was helpful and courteous. Multiple restaurants and things to see there are only a few feet away. There is plenty of shopping and radio city music Hall and NBC studios they’re only a block away

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel itself was fine, the front desk service ranks as some of the worst I have ever experienced. The rooftop was lovely, along with the staff. Such a same the staff couldn't be on the same page. With so many great hotels in the city, if you have the choice...

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Can't think of a better location and a better place. And the service is awesome!However, 1 dark cloud: At the check-out, the kind and nice staff is obliged to charge you a "Destination fee" that you haven't seen coming. Then the poor staff has to explain and try to justify this fee...Be vigilant and add $34/day to your overall planned hotel cost

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I spent 12 nights at the Hyatt Centric for a work trip. After spending several hours researching all nearby properties, I landed on Hyatt based on the location, room type, and reviews. I stayed in the King Suite w/ terrace. I will review a few different elements from my experience:- Location: Everything is so close! Times square is a block away. So many wonderful restaurants to choose from. Central Park is a nice walk. 9/11 memorial is a quick Lyft or taxi ride away. I spent several afternoons just walking and exploring the area.- Room: The room I was in was incredibly spacious by New York Standards. The room came with a refrigerator, desk, separate living room, sizable bathroom and shower. The view from the terrace is amazing! You have a clear view of Times Square, World Trade Center, Empire State building, and so much more. The only non-raving comments I have relate to the bed and pillows. The bed is fairly stiff but after 12 nights, I was accustomed to it. The pillows were so flimsy and seemed old. I asked for foam pillows after the first night (which are offered free of charge), which were only slightly better. The staff was incredibly accommodating and provided extra pillows and blankets.Food (T45 Diner): The food was very good! The restaurant has a nice menu and you can order anything off of that menu for room service. Room service was quicker than any other hotel I have stayed at in the last 5 years. Also, check out Bar54 at the very top of the building. It has breathtaking views and a nice ambience.Hotel Staff: 12 days is a long time to spend at a hotel and I can honestly say that I had great service from the hotel staff for the entire duration of my stay. From a wonderful check-in experience (thank you Ritchie!), the room service staff, the cleaning staff, and security, everyone was professional and kind.Overall, I would recommend this gem to anyone looking for a great place to stay in New York. Well done Hyatt!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We had a great stay here for 5 nights over Christmas. The hotel was very centrally located which made it easy to get around for sightseeing. Considering the hotel is a stone's throw from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, it was remarkably quiet in the bedroom. This was probably helped by the fact we paid extra to be high up, and the 49th floor was a real bonus with great views. The staff were all very friendly with great service from the cleaning staff who couldn't do enough. We didn't eat in the hotel, preferring to go out. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Friendly staff comfortable beds Clean rooms, Excellent location would recommend and stay again enjoyed our stay immensely. Tines Square was a few steps away and the hotels location made navigating New York easy .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My wife and I stayed here in January 2020 after seeing Billy Joel to get a night away from the kiddos. Upon entering the hotel, we were warmly greeted by Eva at the front desk who went above and beyond to make our stay great. We had a King Deluxe room on the 47th floor. The room was tight, but that's to be expected of hotels in Times Square. The room is advertised as a "Times Square view" - for those booking, just be aware you can see about half a block of Times Square.....don't expect to be able to see the ball or anything.Room was very clean. Bathroom was amazing! (Rainfall + handheld shower head, both a standup shower and a tub) Loved that the bed looked out the floor to ceiling wall of windows. No problem with climate control - room was always comfortable. Plenty of storage for what we needed.In the morning we ordered room service. We got the french toast (really good) and the all american breakfast (pretty good, hard to screw that up). Room service was a little pricey, but again, to be expected for a hotel in Times Square.Would definitely stay again if the opportunity came up.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I've stayed at the hotel for a week and half and it was very good.Cleaning service was very good. Just wished i had more day to stay!.Its good for travel and business trip purpose for young couple/ solo traveler and family. Very good location!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I have stayed several times in or near Times Square and this is the most quiet night I have had for sleeping. The room and bed were comfortable and the black out drapes kept the flashing lights out. You can’t do anything about the occasional police sirens. It’s a good location for access to the theaters or subways. Breakfast downstairs was good, efficient, and reasonably priced. Bathroom amenities were sparse but available with a phone call.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is very clean and updated with friendly staff. The rooms were very quiet. It was located very close to Times Square, within walking distance. You could easily get wherever you needed in NYC in a few minutes by subway, taxi, or uber.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed at this location for a family trip, and the hotel was clean, the room was modern, and the location was great. While the bar on the top floor was pricey, it was nice to have somewhere onsite to go. My only criticism would be that a room "with a view of Times Square" doesn't actually overlook times square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Staff very accommodating. Room service faster than expected. Food in restaurant very good.Hostess and wait staff at rooftop bar effecient. Rooftop bar view great. Rooms clean . Valet excellent. Bartender Mickey was wonderful

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I stayed at this hotel twice now and both times found the rooms to be big and spacious, very clean and the staff ready to help with everything. I will stay there again on my next visit to NYC. The location is perfect. When we wanted to see a play last minute, the desk helped us to find perfect tickets at a very affordable price. Thanks.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a weekend Broadway getaway. Nice hotel. Very clean. Good location. (right in the heart of Broadway theater district) Concierge staff was helpful. Price was good. Would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Brilliant location for Times Square, staff helpful too. Rooms ok size and views from roof top lovely however rooms need refurbished. Carpets badly marked and as for pillows, vile. So soiled with blood and whatever they did move us room and replaced pillows with brand new ones

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We came to stay here for Christmas and new year and we fell in love! We had room 4503 which had the most amazing views. The rooms are spotless and the staff are wonderful. Perfect location for everything in New York. On New Year’s Eve we got special nye room keys to keep along with hats, blowers and other party bits which I thought was a nice touch. We will definitely be back in room 4503.Just be aware of resort fees. It’s can add a fair bit onto your holiday.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This has become my favorite property in Manhattan. It's in the theater district, has exceptional service and is fairly priced (especially given the location and level of service!). Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good for a place to leave your belonging and return to the room to sleep only. Rooms do not welcomes you to stay nor work and view (48th floor) not to die for not to mention the room carpet HEAVILY STAINED.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent position very good serviceThe room are very clean everything works fine  the gymnasium is well equipped clean and quite big The roof top bar is very beautiful and the view is amazing all around

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A reasonable hotel in a good location. All expenses were prepaid to try and avoid what seems to be the "NYC tax". My receipt clearly stated "additional tax, fees and service charges". This amount was paid in full some 8 months before our stay. On arrival I was charged a further US$170. I questioned the charge and was told it started one day prior to our arrival. Another excuse was it has been on the web site since 2018. Different responses were obtained from 4 people. Do yourself a favour and book Air BnB wherever you travel. We used this service everywhere else and it was perfect!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel and amazing location if you want to be in heart of Times Square with easy access to Rockefeller and Fifth Avenue shopping. We enjoyed the View from the rooftop bar. Very clean and beautiful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel was wonderful, excellent location! Rooms were clean, food was great and we loved the rooftop bar! Staff was very friendly and the doorman went above and beyond for us. Would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Hotel was very nice and room service was great. Just pay attention to your charges, especially with a credit card authorization form. I was overcharged. They did not pay attention to my charges and I used my limited time to fix it, but was not fully fixed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Nice hotel, friendly staff & guests. I didn’t give it a better rating because of the price & restaurant. Food wasn’t bad, just not very appealing. Breakfast not available for late sleepers. Coffee was not good & service extremely slow for a nearly empty dining room.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: My husband & I stayed here on the 39th floor for a week early December. The check in process was so quick and easy. We arrived to our room and were extremely pleased. It was very clean, quite spacious for NYC and the bathroom was so beautiful. I really appreciated the high end blow drier in the mornings. Having a small bar fridge was nice, free bottles of water was the perfect touch after long days out in the city. The floor to ceiling windows were amazing. We had a partial view of TS but really we were too tired at the end of the day to worry about the view. I'll also note the small things like the coat hooks (meaningful when you have big winter coats), the spacious desk, the amenities being restocked every day, the various light settings and mood lighting. I personally loved hearing Christmas carols in the lobby, such a nice touch to the holiday season. The staff were very helpful when we had questions about the subway, tourist attractions or when we were just looking for a quick answer. The location is perfect, so close to so many attractions. We will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Thank you to the front of house, room servicing and in house security staff. I have to say you all have exceeded our BYC hotel expectations. Once again was thank you. What an amazing hotel with King rooms with amazing views. Hidden gem but a colossal presence, ? A true NYC urban hideaway with the needed luxuries

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Our family had planned this trip 6 months ago as it has been on our bucket list to experience our first trip to NYC and to watch the ball drop on NYE. While searching for rooms online there are many sources indicating Hyatt Centric is a hotel where you can see the ball drop. The room we selected had a description "Times Square view". Prior to booking we called on 2 occasions to ensure we have the perfect room to watch the ball drop and be apart of the exciting celebration. Both times we were advised yes we would see the ball drop. The rooms we booked was very expensive and we thought it was going to be worth it, we were willing to spend the money since we did not want our children in the cold and insane crowd for this celebration. We checked in on 12/30 and was so very disappointed with our room, you could only see the back of a billboard next to a building that blocked most of the view of times square and the ball drop was not in view. Hyatt Centric Times Square NYC hotel was misleading and dishonest from day 1. We spoke to 2 different people at the check-in desk and they said none of their rooms can see the ball drop and we could purchase the top of the bar access for $1000 +per person if we wanted to see the ball drop...... they genuinely was not concerned about our disapointment. Their goal was to move us along and check in the next person. We booked 2 rooms for our family of 6 people and spent over $5k at this hotel. I called the front desk to ask for a manager and she apologized and said they would credit me for the inconvenience, I received a folio with a credit of $80 and then they charged me $100 without providing the folio for the 2nd room or explaining why I was charged. I am reaching out to the hotel to inquire and will be generating a complaint to the FTC.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel was awesome. My view of time square was memorable and the bathroom was to die for. I was able to take a bath in the sunken tub. I would definitely stay here again. The service was awesome as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I payed a supplement to have high-floor room (and a special request for well isolated from noise room) : I finally got as a result a room on 34th floor during 4 nights with view but not over Time Square. No problem at all with no direct view in the spotlight of TS because the room was quite well isolated but I would appreciate to be in higher floor to avoid being opposite to office workers in other buildings while I was undress .... I have been in higher floor for example in Las Vegas though it was during New Year’s Eve holidays.Pros : perfect location, almost every point of interest was accessible by walking.and walking in this area was a nice experience to discover Manhattan.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I would highly recommend this hotel. The entire staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. The room was very clean, quiet & comfortable with amazing view of Times Square. Excellent location to many highlights of the city. Will definitely return!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed Boxing Day until 2 Jan. Hotel was full due to holiday season and due to very close proximity to Times Square security was tight during our visit due to NYE celebrations but hotel were extremely well organised and notified guests in plenty time with what we needed to do to negotiate the barriers/NYPD. There were even Police in reception permanently for days leading up to NYE. Felt very safe and secure!Rooms were lovely and clean, bathrooms huge and lovely comfy beds.Only slight negative is the excessive “location fee” they charge on check-out. Over $30 a night was a bit of a surprise as we stayed 7 nights so it added a fair bit on to what we had already paid in advance. This needs to be clearer on booking.Rooftop bar - amazing views but with $19 for 1 small glass of wine you defo pay for the view!! Overall, a great stay and I have already recommended it to a friend.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The hotel is very nice with a great staff. My issue is with the hidden fees. I paid $199 (including “fees” and taxes) ahead of our stay. When I went to check in, the person at the desk said everything was paid for but a credit card was needed in case we ordered room service. I gave them my card. Big mistake! Next day at check out I had an additional new “fee” for $35!!! This $35 is on top of taxes. In fact, the total NYC taxes were a little less than the Hyatt fee.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is how I will describe my stay at Hyatt centric. I spent my New Years in Times Square and Opted for this property because it’s just two minutes from Times Square.Everything was smooth until the day before my checkout I noticed three of my cosmetics for missing and yes I was carrying them when I Checked into the property. In spite of informing the housekeeping manager about this who assured me that they will look at it at the earliest and mail me.its been four days But I haven’t heard anything from them , because they just don’t care.The room cleaning attendant dint know even a bit about the incident. I have even mailed the property regarding this matter but no one has bothered to reply or look into same.Point is today it was cosmetics .. but it could have been any other exp item also ... they should take responsibility and act on this ! Also few staff of the property behave very rude.I will definitely not recommend this property Marriot Marquis is a better choice for sure. Such an amazing trip of mine had a bad end Cz of this property !

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Absolutely high price and very poor quality of rooms. I had executive suite where power stations didn’t work, bed sofa not comfortable, bathroom towels for one while we were four, furniture broken. Long short very old and not maintained hotel for prices like luxury style. Only location perfect even if hotel should be completely renovated and personnel changed.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A little disappointed to say that it was an expensive 3 nights stay. Rooms are very spacious clean with good amenities and beds are very comfy. Bath towels are tiny we asked for larger but none available. Great views of parts of Times Square. The bar 54 roof top bar was nothing like the photos i had seen prior to going. The views were amazing though. Wanted to charge $50 dollars per hour for a later check out. Reception is tiny and fairly unorganised and ended up waiting on benches on street until transfer picked us up. Overly expensive drinks and not worth paying to have breakfast as what we paid 90 dollars for you could have got for a quarter of the price And double the portions at either of the two irish pubs which are either side of the hotel. If I went again I would not pay for being on or near Times Square its over priced and over rated.The concierge was very helpful and friendly

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Expensive with no advantages Was given a tiny room for 4 adultsLater changed to larger room when a new staff member was at desk Bathroom tiny and not well stocked They were out of stock for bedroom slippers

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: No help with New Year’s Eve planning and concierge lied about costs and times/convenience of activities. Rooms were not completely cleaned daily. Linens were not adequately supplied. Staff was not helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good location great service for being the week of Christmas walk right out onto times square. Everyone at the front desk was super helpful and the view from the rooftop bar was spectacular. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall, this is a nice hotel in a great location. The one thing that spoiled out stay is that we were not able to enjoy the rooftop restaurant with our 18 year old daughter. There is absolutely no reason to restrict access to 21 years and older. Any of the Irish Pubs next door allow you to bring your kids. The rooftop restaurant is very nice and asking you to leave your adult kids behind is just not what I’d expect.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed for a weekend. Location is perfect. Hotel is centrally located, walkable. Close to everything. Staff helpful. Only compliant is room service is expensive but delivered in a brown bag versus a set cart table.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: 1. Red blood on sheet and dried blood on pillow case. Remediation was terrible by house staff.2. Heat in second room turned on at 77F3. When we checked out, their garage couldn't find our car for over an hour. It was moved and new ticket was not given to us.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at the Hyatt Centric for 3 days through New Years. Great room on 46th floor with Times Square view. We had a 1 bedroom suite for 3 people. The bed and sleeper sofa were comfortable and the rooms were large enough to be comfortable considering we were in New York. Central Park was a short walk and 9/11 Memorial and The Statue of Liberty a short Uber ride away.. The elevator was really fast.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location steps from Time Square Ball drop area. The rooms were comfortable and staff were awesome. Although busy holiday weekend, they were very efficient and responsive. Denise at the front desk as so nice!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Excellent hotel, staff, decor, and right in prime Times Square location. We were there for NYE and they had a goodie bag for my 10 year old daughter to make the night special for kids. The rooms had great windows with views too!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: A NYC Holiday TripMy husband and I spent 5 fabulous days at the Hyatt Centric Hotel near Times Square. The hotel was in walking distance to the theaters and the Morgan Library. We were also conveniently located near subways and bus stops. The hotel was modern and beautifully appointed. We will definitely return.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Stayed at a king size room bed with view, everything as expected. Clean, noise free and cozy. Location is one of the best advantage s of this hotel, near to times square subway which enables you to go anywhere fast. Will go again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Janu and mirza were fantastic, very polite and really lovely!!!!The place is so nice and cool at the same time. Food good , many chooice and a lot of People who like this lovely restaurant.We came here firma the end of 2019 and only in this place, peole were really polite

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This property has a perfect location for Times Square, Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral. The rooms are spacious and clean. Was a wonderful Christmas trip! I would recommend this property if visiting NYC and interested in staying around Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel is seconds from the heart of Times Square and it's in close proximity to all. Great hotel amenities. One of the highlights of this hotel are the spectacular views you get on the balcony of the 54th floor. I would come back again.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We took my parents (70s) and our 4 year old to NYC just before the Christmas holiday. This was the perfect home base...service was really good...my Mom had a mobility scooter delivered and we left something in our room the morning of checkout...they were super responsive and easy going about both thing in addition to always greeting us with a smile every day. The restaurant connected to the hotel was a good breakfast, drink, dinner spot that we utilized several times during our stay to keep it simple and easy.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Perfectly located hotel in the Time Square. They have the highest rooftop bar in Bar 54. It has amazing views that you get for free instead of paying for an observation deck. The drinks and food were great at the hotel. I got a high floor upgrade. I was hoping for a suite upgrade but I didn’t get one. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Time Square. You will love it.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel with fabulous customer service. I will definitely go back to this hotel and would highly recommend it. Clean rooms and extremely friendly staff. Location was perfect for theatre and shopping

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The Centric is a traveller's dream in terms of location - whatever you want to do and see, you are at the heart of it on West 45th Street. Minutes from Times Square, handy for the Rock, Empire State, Union Station, Bryant Park, theatres, subway so that you can easily access Battery Park and out to Statue of Liberty and One World Tower, Madison Square Gardens to see the Ice Hockey (highly recommended) and anywhere you want to go at that end of the city. The rooms and beds are comfortable and well furnished (although one of our lights did not work) and the floor to ceiling windows in our Suite were superb. The staff at check-in were less than friendly but everyone else we met were lovely. The hotel has a rooftop bar with superb views day and night and it is a nice place to sit and have a drink after a busy day sightseeing. We had a lovely lady from Jamaica who cleaned our room and she could not have been any more friendly, chatty or helpful - I'm only sorry I did not get her name. The Assistant Operations Manager, Mr Rico Hernandez, was also very helpful when my daughter was unwell during our stay. I had breakfast in our room one morning and it was perfectly pleasant - fluffy, warm pancakes and hot tea. Reception staff were happy to organise more pillows, provide a sewing kit after a slight wardrobe malfunction and to provide a kettle when my daughter needed one. The bar downstairs is ideal for a drink or snack at the end of the day and the staff were nice - they even put drinks in plastic glasses to take up to your room on the one night we couldn't go out as planned when my daughter was unwell. The hotel was nicely decorated for the festive season and staff are very knowledgable and helpful. The hotel helped us arrange transfers to and from the airport, which was very reasonable and worked well. We were given a late checkout of 2pm as our flight was not until 8pm, and we apreciated this extra time to relax a bit. The only negative comment I have was on the location of our Suite. Security staff check that you have a key, so nobody can get around to the lifts and rooms without being challenged. We were in Room 1401 (suite), which is right above the main front entrance. Given the location of the hotel and the vibrant nature of New York, we fully expected noise. However, I did expect that we would get a night's sleep! Sad to say, none of us had one night's sleep in the 7 days of our holiday. The beds are so comfy it shouldn't be a problem, but the noise was horrendous! It starts at Midnight with a Refuse Collection right under your window which takes time, and all the associated noise/engine running (sometimes collectng from the other side of the road from restaurants etc), then there is another type of collection at around 3 am and then again at around 5 am. There is also a tremendous amount of building work/renovations and repairs to buildings to prevent falling masonry taking place and this goes on all night too, as the building with work across the road has a permit to work during the night, as do many buildings in the city. On one of the nights this led to work at 2 am where the street had one side coned off and an enormous truck full of supplies and 2 small vehicles going up and down with materials for several hours. I appreciate that this is not the fault of the Hyatt, however, had we had any knowledge of this we would not have stayed in this room! A good night's sleep means you can explore this amazing city in all it's glory all day and late into the night. As it was the run up to Christmas, the hotel was extremely busy or we would have enquired about a change of room. We feel that this coloured our view of value for money for this Suite - given the issues (and having stayed in many other Hyatt hotels and in busy cities), we feel that the price per night was too high. We did have a fantatstic holiday and can highly recommend a visit to ew York at this time of year. The hotel is really nice, but some prior information about the rooms would have been good. With a different room, we would recommend a stay here as the location cannot be beaten and it is a nice hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Good hotel in a great location! Stayed in corner suite which was good, though had a very small bathroom for a suite.  Restaurant / Bar in lobby has great options, and service was quick. Expect Street noises throughout the night, but it's part of the experience staying in the heart of the city .

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We stayed for 7 nights at this hotel and I was pretty happy with our choice. Great location tfor getting around NYC. The room was a good size with good wardrobe space and some draws to put clothes in. We paid for the heated floors and I was pleased we did. Housekeeping was great and our room was lovely and clean. The only thing that I was not happy about is the destination fee which I felt was a complete rip off.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Aside from the rock hard beds, terrible pillows, and getting hammered on the way back in during the evenings by hotel staff wanting us to prove in some way we were guests before we could get on the elevator... it was a good experience. As soon as the sweet cleaning staff found out there were 4 of us in one room, they gave us extra towels and toiletries to help with our stay. I made sure to tip them every day to show our appreciation. The front desk accepted a delivery for me and then left it in our room while we were at a Broadway show like I asked them to - which was extremely helpful because it was meant to be a surprise upon our return to the room. =) We requested extra pillows because ours provided zero support, but literally, no matter how many you added, they went flat and you woke up with a sore neck the next day. As for getting questioned in the evenings when we went to get on the elevator... I know they are doing it because of the rooftop bar, but still, it's a hassle when you're just wanting to go to your room and don't want to have to stop to dig for a key to prove yourself. My daughter witnessed someone's son who ran down to get something from the front desk for his dad get stopped for a long period of time because he didn't take his room key down with him. I don't know how they can make this better, but it gets annoying. Overall, it's a nice hotel in a great location, and we would stay there again. I'd probably just have to pack a pillow! Haha!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This hotel has gone downhill in quality of service and overall condition of hotel. We had the WORST experience last week and have stayed multiple times before and never will again. We had to fix our own curtain that had come off the rails, we had a previous guests dirty underwear and clothes left in our room and room service was absolutely terrible!!!!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: First, this hotel is in a great location to be a tourist in the city. The check in staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiful. Great size, and we had an amazing view of One World Trade. We make a trip annually and will be going back to this hotel moving forward.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great hotel. Room was nice size, bathroom big with great shower and lots of room to put personal items. Very quiet even though right near Times Square. All the coffee and water we wanted, courteous staff, good price.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: For the price paid carpets should have been cleaned and desk should have a rolling chair. Location was great, access to transportation, shows and places to eat where excellent. Just a bit disappointed in the room

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We chose this hotel based on it's location and reviews, and it did not disappoint. Sean at the valet made an amazing first impression with his friendly and warm personality, and it only continued from there. The lobby was decorated beautifully for the holidays and they even had warm chocolate chip cookies out for the guests, which was such a nice touch. The front desk staff was great (I wish I remembered her name), and she even upgraded us to a room with two queen beds so that I wouldn't have to request a rollaway bed for my daughter. The room was clean and just perfect for us. The heated floors were the icing on the cake after walking around NYC in the cold weather, and the beds were heavenly. I only wish we were able to have enjoyed the hotel a little longer, but we will definitely be back! I cannot recommend this hotel enough!

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: We recently spent two nights at the Hyatt Centric. the acommodations could not have been better. The hotel is conveniently situated less than a block from Times Square. The staff was welcoming and helpful. Our room was contemporary and well-appointed. The fitness center is clean and features state-of-the-art equipment. We look forward to our inevitable return to this fine hotel.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Very clean and tidy room. Only one minute to Times Square. Some staff I talked during my stay were friendly and nice enough, but some were not which was a kind of disappointed. Would recommend this hotel for those who want to experience the heat and sound of noise from Times Square.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: This is one of my favorites for business in NYC. It's worth checking the rates, as they vary quite a bit depending on the time of year. If you've seen Times Square before, the rooms on the north side are quieter and darker. Many good restaurants nearby, about 5 minute walk to a couple subway stops.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The location was perfect and everything went smoothly. Couldn't ask for a better experience. We were within walking distance from most of the major attractions and that made our stay that much nicer. Will stay here next time we visit.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, friendly staff and clean hotel! Hotel staff checks room keys after dark, makes you feel safe. Rooms are spacious but Looking forward to staying at the Hyatt Times Square next year and getting 2 rooms for our family.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Overall a very nice hotel in perfect Manhattan location. Close to everything. Rooftop bar was great and main ground floor restaurant was very nice. Very easy check-in and checkout. Everything is expensive in NYC and prices at the Hyatt were consistent with others.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Walking distance to most all sites we visited on this holiday season visit. Actually only had one significant wait for the elevator when checking out. Seems other times we missed the busy periods. Very comfortable and well kept facility. Staff was very good as well.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: I want to just say that Diana at the front desk and Eva (cleaning crew) were SUPER friendly and made our stay here exceptional. I would go as far as to say it was one of the most pleasurable experiences due to their happiness and helpfulness. We felt more than welcomed here due to them and it made the stay SO much better.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: The rooms are a nice size larger than the W. The 54th Floor bar and outdoor balcony provide outstanding photo ops. DeDe, Eva and Diana took great care of us!!! Better than the hotel Concierge--more helpful.

hotel_name: Hyatt Centric Times Square New York
review_body: Great location, but the room is very basic and not what you might expect when staying in a HYATT. They miss the little things that make a HYATT a true HYATT. I had to go back to the desk to get them to turn on the phone, which should have been done upon checking in. Had to ask for enough towels to support the 4 adults we had booked the reservation for. They only put two in the room. These are small misses, but as a HYATT gold passport member and owner, I expected a much higher quality room, and more attention to detail, especially at the heart of NYC.
